definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
"cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 27), occurring in 原, 历, 压 etc

sentences.english: They create an optical illusion that the Mint hopes is almost impossible to duplicate.
sentences.chinese: 他们有一种错觉，造币厂觉得这几乎是不可能复制的。

sentences.english: CHINA. Kwangtung. Heaton Mint at Birmingham Specimen Set, 1888 (1890). Heaton Mint at Birmingham.
sentences.chinese: 1888年英国伯明翰喜敦造币厂样币一套。

sentences.english: I had a cousin who worked in the U. S. Mint.
sentences.chinese: 我有个表兄弟在美国造币厂工作。

sentences.english: Economy the poor man's mints; extravagance the rich man's pitfall.(Martin Tupper.
sentences.chinese: 节约是穷人的造币厂，浪费是富人的陷阱。

sentences.english: Economy is the poor man' s mint; and extravagance the rich man ' s pitfall.
sentences.chinese: 节省是贫平易近的造币厂，华侈是富翁的陷阱。

sentences.english: The Royal Mint will strike a commemorative gold coin.
sentences.chinese: 英国皇家造币厂将铸造一种纪念金币。
造币厂正在铸造每枚价值一便士的硬币。

sentences.english: The mint have decide to issue the coin next year.
sentences.chinese: 这家造币厂已决定明年发行硬币。

sentences.english: Economy the poor man's mints; extravagance the rich man's pitfall. (Martin Tupper. American economist. )
sentences.chinese: 节省是贫平易近的造币厂，华侈是富人的陷阱。
